snippet: Berlin officials estimated that a one-time payment of back taxes could bring in a windfall of up to €10 billion, or $13 billion, and annual payments thereafter.
abstract: Switzerland agrees to a revised tax deal with Germany under which it would pay billions of dollars on funds hidden in its banks by German tax dodgers; German officials estimated that a one-time payment of back taxes could bring in a windfall of up to10 billion euros ($13 billion), and annual payments thereafter.
lead_paragraph: Berlin officials estimated that a one-time payment of back taxes could bring in a windfall of up to €10 billion, or $13 billion, and annual payments thereafter.

headline.seo: Germans and Swiss Reach Stricter Deal on Tax Cheats

headline.print_headline: Germany Reaches Accord on Tax Evaders
